text: :wave: hi Dana, I can offer a little bit of clarity here. We didn't change anything specifically related to the modules themselves lately, but we did find a very small subset of portals that were in a weird state where the default HubSpot modules were editable. This wasn't intentional, and we've been working to clean those up so this may have been what you saw. The infrastructure around those default modules means that we can deploy bug fixes and version updates to them quickly, but if they were customisable those changes we make would blow away any customisations you'd made. It's a necessary part of the default modules unfortunately but you can clone them inside of Design Manager and make versions that suit specific needs as an alternative too. Let me know if I can help out at all.
You can shoot me a msg here or to <mailto:shay@HubSpot.com|shay@HubSpot.com> with the portal ID and I can add it to your account :+1:

In a good way or a bad way, Dennis? (I guess a bad way...) Would you be able to share your feedback with me to <mailto:shay@HubSpot.com|shay@HubSpot.com> and I can bring it to my team to see what we can help with?

You can share here, or you can always email me at <mailto:shay@HubSpot.com|shay@HubSpot.com>. Sorry I've been a little quiet on here lately, it's been pretty busy in the walls of HubSpot lately :sweat_smile:

:faceplam: out of interest AJ, does that padding hang around when you send the email? We're pulling apart some of the padding customisations inside of the drag and drop editor at the moment and there's a small amount of padding that's added _just_ within the editor itself to help provide some spacing for module buttons/hover states, but it's not included in the actual email that gets sent out. We're working on alternative solutions for this, it's misleading and we don't like it
It could also be that the padding is coming from the `Layout` that's wrapped around the module, this is customisable in-editor, example: <http://g.recordit.co/m12jVOiVag.gif>
Ill take a look and see (might still have it in my inbox)
Thanks :pray:
In outlook it appears it is showing, the pink is the bg applied to the full width style
heres a better view with some of outlook in it
Outlook 2016 on a PC (as I know Mac's Outlook renders different from the PC one)
The padding we're talking about in this case is the black line at the very top?
yup
as you mentioned, some of the padding from my previous screenshot was from the editor, but the black line at the top (and sides) from the above is what is also there
Gotcha, thanks for confirming. Taking a look, two mins
Yup, confirmed. This is <http://outlook.com|outlook.com>: <https://chromeoutlookcom.capture.litmuscdn.com/5a6feb84-0f34-4534-831a-39086c4c185a/results/chromeoutlookcom-vertical-allowed-1366.png>
This is outlook 2016 desktop app: <https://ol2016.capture.litmuscdn.com/5a6feb84-0f34-4534-831a-39086c4c185a/results/ol2016-vertical-allowed-1366.png>
I don't think this is covered in what I mentioned above, this is just some fallback issue in outlook. Leave it with me and I'll see what we can do :+1:
#outlookForTheWin
Building emails like a boss, then Outlook jumps in #WordUp (bad geek joke)
Not going to lie, I had to re-read that a couple times :sweat_smile: bravo :clap:
Its a joke that only the most tortured developers will get
Will try to collect some notes. A lot of responsive issues. Such as centering text on mobile
